dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news out of the markets yesterday, right? Not exactly a stellar day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news out of the markets yesterday, right? Not exactly a stellar day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock market continued to rally higher on Wednesday, as the S&P 500 hit a new record close and the Dow rose almost 500 points, with stocks now recovering most of their losses related to the coronavirus during the past two weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all, Host_A. I mean, the stumble, it just continued. Especially for the Dow and S&P.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all, Host_A. I mean, the stumble, it just continued. Especially for the Dow and S and P.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 index rose 1.1% on Wednesday, hitting a new record closing high of 3334.69... The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped nearly 500 points, gaining 1.7%...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the S&P 500, um, it actually closed at a new record high *number*, which is kinda wild, but still fell 1.1% for the day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the S and P five hundred, um, it actually closed at a new record high number, which is kinda wild, but still fell one point one percent for the day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 index rose 1.1% on Wednesday, hitting a new record closing high of 3334.69...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it's like a paradox, isn't it? And the Dow, man, it just plunged, like, almost 500 points. [interrupts] Pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it's like a paradox, isn't it? And the Dow, man, it just plunged, like, almost five hundred points. Pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped nearly 500 points, gaining 1.7%...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, nearly 500 points! All this, you know, stemming from those intensifying fears over the coronavirus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, nearly five hundred points! All this, you know, stemming from those intensifying fears over the coronavirus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 index rose 1.1% on Wednesday, hitting a new record closing high of 3334.69 and fully erasing its losses stemming from fears over the coronavirus and its impact on businesses and the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It's really hitting businesses and, uh, the global economy. Everyone's just worried about that impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It's really hitting businesses and, uh, the global economy. Everyone's just worried about that impact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The coronavirus-linked work stoppages and travel restrictions will have a material impact on global growth, Crisafulli recently predicted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But, um, surprisingly, the Nasdaq didn't take as big a hit. Only dropped, what, 0.4%?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But, um, surprisingly, the Nasdaq didn't take as big a hit. Only dropped, what, zero point four percent?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Nasdaq Composite index, on the other hand, lagged both the Dow and S&P 500, gaining only 0.4%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was interesting. And a big part of that, apparently, was Tesla.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was interesting. And a big part of that, apparently, was Tesla.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Nasdaq was held back in large part because Tesla shares, which soared up to 50% earlier this week, plunged by almost 20% on Wednesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, my gosh, Tesla! They soared almost 20% yesterday. Like, their best day ever, despite being down 70% for the year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, my gosh, Tesla! They soared almost twenty percent yesterday. Like, their best day ever, despite being down seventy percent for the year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Tesla shares... plunged by almost 20% on Wednesdayits worst day ever... Even with Wednesdays record plunge, Tesla stock is still up more than 70% in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? Wild. All because of, like, reports that the virus won't impact their Shanghai factory production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? Wild. All because of, like, reports that the virus won't impact their Shanghai factory production.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...amid reports that the coronavirus would impact production and deliveries at its factory in Shanghai, China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, crazy. But then, to add to the bad news, we had that ADP report, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, crazy. But then, to add to the bad news, we had that A D P report, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adding to the good news for the market on Wednesday was a report from ADP and Moodys Analytics...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the payrolls! Yeah, a decrease of 291,000 in January. That's, like, the biggest monthly loss in five years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the payrolls! Yeah, a decrease of two hundred ninety one thousand in January. That's, like, the biggest monthly loss in five years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...U.S. private payrolls rose by 291,000 in Januaryalmost twice the expected number and the biggest monthly payroll gain in almost five years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Brutal. So, all three major indexes, like, posted losses for the third day in a row.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Brutal. So, all three major indexes, like, posted losses for the third day in a row.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All three major indexes have now posted gains for the third day in a row, marking a recovery from a huge sell-off on coronavirus fears last Friday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which just totally reverses that positive trend we were *hoping* to see.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which just totally reverses that positive trend we were hoping to see.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. S&P 500 is actually negative for 2020 now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. S and P five hundred is actually negative for twenty twenty now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 has now fully recovered from its coronavirus-related losses, turning positive for 2020 so far. The index is now up 1.2% for the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what's the word from analysts? More downside, uh, coming our way?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what's the word from analysts? More downside, uh, coming our way?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it sounds like it. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge, he's saying that, um, the "bearish narrative" is firmly back in control.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it sounds like it. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge, he's saying that, um, the bearish narrative is firmly back in control.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bullish narrative thats been driving stocks since late 2019 is firmly back in control of the tape after taking a brief pause during the final days of January.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Man, it just feels like a perfect storm, doesn't it? This virus just keeps everything, like, on edge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man, it just feels like a perfect storm, doesn't it? This virus just keeps everything, like, on edge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What to watch for: The coronavirus continuing impact on businesses, especially those with heavy exposure to China.
